company.name: Central Credit, LLC
company.address: 3525 East Post Road, Suite 120, Las Vegas, Nevada 89120
company.business_description: Central Credit, a wholly owned subsidiary of Global Cash Access, Inc., maintains check-writing history information and credit information on consumers across the United States. The company sells credit reports to casinos (subscribers), which use the reports to make credit decisions or licensing decisions. Central Credit also provides check verification and check warranty services.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) and 16(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 56(a); and Sections 607(d), 609(c), 612(a)(1)(C) and (a)(2), and 621 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681e, 1681g, and 1681s

complaint.factual_background: Central Credit, LLC, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Global Cash Access, Inc., operates as a consumer reporting agency and nationwide specialty consumer reporting agency that sells information about consumers' gaming experiences and check-cashing transactions to casinos. Prior to 2008, Central Credit failed to provide required Furnisher Notices to information furnishers and User Notices to users of consumer reports as mandated by Section 607(d) of the FCRA. Central Credit also failed to include all required information in its Summary of Rights notices provided to consumers during file disclosures. Additionally, Central Credit never established the streamlined process required by the FTC's Streamlined Process Rule — including a clearly and prominently posted toll-free number on its website — for consumers to request free annual file disclosures. These violations were knowing and constituted a pattern or practice of non-compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

representations_made.description: Central Credit failed to provide Furnisher Notices to furnishers and User Notices to users of consumer reports, as required by Section 607(d) of the FCRA

counts.title: Failure to Provide Furnisher and User Notices — Section 607(d) FCRA
counts.representation: Prior to 2008, Central Credit failed to provide Furnisher Notices to furnishers or User Notices to users of consumer reports
counts.fact: Section 607(d)(1) of the FCRA requires consumer reporting agencies to provide a 'Notice To Furnishers of Information: Obligations of Furnishers Under the FCRA' to any person who regularly furnishes information, and Section 607(d)(2) requires a 'Notice To Users of Consumer Reports: Obligations of Users Under the FCRA' to any person to whom it provides a consumer report
counts.conclusion: By and through the acts and practices described in Paragraph 13, Central Credit violated Section 607(d) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681e(d), and these acts also constitute unfair or deceptive acts or practices in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a).

counts.title: Failure to Provide Adequate Summary of Rights — Section 609(c)(2) FCRA
counts.representation: Prior to 2008, Central Credit failed to provide a Summary of Rights notice that contained all of the information required by Section 609(c)(1)(B) of the FCRA when providing written file disclosures to consumers
counts.fact: Section 609(c)(2) of the FCRA requires that when a consumer reporting agency provides a file disclosure to a consumer, a Summary of Rights must be provided to the consumer along with each written file disclosure, informing consumers of their rights such as the right to dispute inaccurate information
counts.conclusion: By and through the acts and practices described in Paragraph 17, Central Credit violated Section 609(c)(2) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681g(c)(2), and these acts also constitute unfair or deceptive acts or practices in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a).

counts.title: Failure to Establish Streamlined Process for Free Annual File Disclosures — Sections 612(a)(1)(C) and 612(a)(2) FCRA and Streamlined Process Rule
counts.representation: Central Credit has not established the streamlined process required by the Streamlined Process Rule, 16 C.F.R. § 610.3, for consumers to request free annual file disclosures; among other things, it has not clearly and prominently posted the toll-free telephone number on any website it owns or maintains, and has failed to provide clear and easily understandable instructions for requesting free annual file disclosures on its toll-free number
counts.fact: Section 612(a)(1)(C) of the FCRA directed the Commission to prescribe regulations requiring nationwide specialty consumer reporting agencies to establish a streamlined process — including a toll-free number clearly and prominently posted on any owned or maintained website, along with instructions for requesting disclosures by any additional available methods — for consumers to request free annual file disclosures; the FTC promulgated the Streamlined Process Rule (16 C.F.R. § 610.3), effective December 4, 2004, implementing this requirement
counts.conclusion: By and through the acts and practices described in Paragraph 22, Central Credit violated Sections 612(a)(1)(C) and 612(a)(2) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681j(a)(1)(C) and 1681j(a)(2), and Section 610.3 of the Streamlined Process Rule, 16 C.F.R. § 610.3.

definitions.Defendant: Central Credit, LLC, and its successors and assigns.
definitions.FCRA definitions: The definitions set forth in the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681a, et seq., and the Streamlined Process Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 610, shall apply.

provisions.title: Civil Penalty
provisions.summary: Defendant must pay a $150,000 civil penalty to the United States within seven business days of service of the Order, with default interest provisions and relinquishment of all rights to the funds.

requirements.description: Defendant shall pay a civil penalty of $150,000 pursuant to section 621(a) of the FCRA

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities
provisions.summary: Defendant and all persons acting in concert with it are permanently enjoined from failing to provide required FCRA notices to users, furnishers, and consumers, and from failing to maintain a streamlined process for free annual file disclosures.

requirements.description: Permanently enjoined from failing to provide the 'User Notice' required by FCRA section 607(d) to all users of Defendant's consumer reports

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Defendant's compliance through written reports, document production, depositions, facility access, discovery, and undercover posing as consumers or suppliers.

requirements.description: Within ten (10) days of receipt of written notice from the Commission, Defendant shall submit additional written reports sworn under penalty of perjury, produce documents, appear for deposition, and provide entry to business locations during normal business hours

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting by Defendant
provisions.summary: Defendant must notify the Commission of structural changes and submit sworn written compliance reports for three years, notify of bankruptcy filings, and send all reports by overnight courier or first-class mail with electronic copy.

requirements.description: For three (3) years from the date of entry of this Order, Defendant shall notify the Commission of any changes in structure of Defendant or any other business entity it controls or has an ownership interest in that may affect compliance obligations, at least thirty (30) days prior to such change

provisions.title: Record Keeping Provisions
provisions.summary: For six years from entry of the Order, Defendant must create and retain specified records including user/furnisher files, training materials, compliance documents, and any records that contradict compliance.

requirements.description: For six (6) years from the date of entry of this Order, Defendant must retain files containing names, addresses, and telephone numbers of all users and furnishers who received the section 607(d) User Notice and Furnisher Notice, and all materials demonstrating compliance

provisions.title: Distribution of Order by Defendant
provisions.summary: For three years, Defendant must deliver copies of the Order to all principals, officers, directors, managers, relevant employees, and successor entities, and obtain signed acknowledgments within thirty days of delivery.

requirements.description: Defendant must deliver a copy of this Order to (1) all principals, officers, directors, and managers; (2) all employees, agents, and representatives who engage in conduct related to the subject matter of the Order; and (3) any business entity resulting from any structural change. Delivery to current personnel within five (5) days of service; to new personnel prior to assuming responsibilities; to successor entities at least ten (10) days prior to the structural change

provisions.title: Acknowledgment of Receipt of Order
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a truthful sworn statement to the Commission acknowledging receipt of this Order within five business days of receipt.

requirements.description: Defendant, within five (5) business days of receipt of this Order as entered by the Court, must submit to the Commissiona truthful sworn statement acknowledging receipt of this Order

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: This Court retains jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.

requirements.description: This Court shall retain jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order
requirements.quoted_text: IITT IISS FFUUTTHHEERR OORRDDEERREEDD tthhaatt tthhiiss CCoouurrtt sshhaallll rreettaaiinn jjuurriissddiiccttiioonn ooff tthhiiss mmaatttteerr ffoorr ppuurrppoosseess ooff ccoonnssttrruuccttiioonn,, mmooddiiffiiccaattiioonn,, aanndd eennffoorrcceemmeenntt ooff tthhiiss OOrrddeerr..

provisions.title: Costs and Attorneys' Fees
provisions.summary: Each party shall bear its own costs and attorneys' fees incurred in connection with this action.

requirements.description: Each party shall bear its own costs and attorneys' fees incurred in connection with this action

duration.termination_text: IT IS FUTTHER ORDERED that this Court shall retain jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.
